column2: In the following series of steps the RNA is removed from the DNA-RNA hybrid and a replacement strand is synthesized, thereby generating double-stranded cDNA.

Add the following reagents, in this order, to the first-strand reaction tube fromstep (Illumina First Strand cDNA synthesis).9 (total volume should be 150 _l).91 _l nuclease-free H2O30 _l 5_ second strand buffer (1_ final)3 _l 10 mM dNTP mix (0.2 mM final)1 _l 10 U/_l E. coli DNA ligase4 _l 10 U/_l E. coli DNA polymerase I1 _l 2 U/_l E. coli RNase H.

column5: Add reagents in the order listed

column2: Mix well by pipetting up and down
column5: well, by pipetting up and down

column2: incubate for 2 hr at 16_C in a thermal cycler.

column5: Take care not to allow the temperature to rise above 16_C

column2: Add 2 _l of 5 U/_l T4 DNA polymerase
mix by pipetting up and down
incubate at 16_C for an additional 5 min

column5: Invitrogen recommends this step for second-strand cDNA synthesis and, while an end repair with T4 DNA polymerase will be done again in steps (Illumina, End repair of fragmented ds cDNA).1-3, a slight increase in mappable reads is typically obtained when this step is included (unpub. observ.).

column2: microcentrifuge briefly to collect solution at bottoms of tubes

column5: to collect the contents of the tube

column2: Purify the double-stranded cDNA product using Qiagen's QIAquick PCR Purifi-cation Kit.

column5: Nucleic Acid, DNA, double-stranded, dissolved in Buffer EB
Nucleic Acid, DNA, double-stranded, dissolved in Buffer EB
Follow the manufacturer's recommended protocol, but elute in a finalvolume of 25 _l of Buffer EB.
